items.preText: Thanks, Vishal, and hello everyone! Good to be here. Needless to say, today's match will come down to which team's spinners do better. I know Asghar said the pitch looked good for batting, but my hunch is spinners will still have the final say. This has been their tournament. Anyway, let's find out for ourselves. The ever-dynamic, ever-tantalising Mohammad Shahzad will take first strike. And Rubel Hossain will begin with his raw pace. 3.29pm National anthems done, birthday wishes sent, coffee brewed, and Akshay is here to begin the match. Ferdows : "Wow! Rashid khan is 20 yrs old? He looks like only 15 to be honest." 3.25pm Oh hello, it's Rashid Khan's birthday! He's turned 20. One of the biggest rising stars, one of those who can't be picked easily off the hand, a proper T20 bowler with his zippy legbreaks, variations, trajectory, and that's not it. He's No. 2 in ICC's ODI rankings for bowlers too. From Bangladesh, it looks like Nazmul will open with Liton, and Mominul will probably bat at No. 4. And Isam reminds me that Mushfiqur has a rib injury with which he played against Sri Lanka. Good day to get some rest in an air-conditioned room in the scorching heat. NoduRijvyBD: "Given all the matches of India will be in Dubai, it has again been proved that this is the world of imperfection and we all just enjoy watching it :( " 3.13pm We have the news: Mominul is the third inclusion. But Bangladesh are without three key players, all match-winners. Will this move help Afghanistan and maybe dent Bangladesh's confidence if they end up losing? Here's something from another match-winner: Shakib Al Hasan: Mushfiqur played a tremendous knock, probably his best in ODI. I always believe that we have a very good ODI bowling side, everyone knows their job and we need to perform on a consistent basis. "Why it is called dead rubber.... there is no carry-over points for super 4 stage?" That's right, Deb. No carry over points Toss: Afghanistan have won the toss and opted to bat Asghar has made one change: brings in Shenwari for Najibullah Zadran. He things the pitch is good for batting and they want to post a total close to 250. Mashrafe says he wanted to bat too. He forgets the third change they've made but remembers they've left out Tamim (forced), Mushfiqur and Mustafizur. The two debutants are Abu Hider and Nazmul Hossain, and we'll tell you soon who's the third inclusion. Shekh yousuf: "I think today is not playing Bangladeshi opener & hard hitter Tamim Iqbal . So it will be plus point for Afghan team to win in this mach " Shaheen: "Today with Rashid's googly, Mujib's new magic we will beat BD as our last opponent before super 4 Inshallah" 2.59pm Sunil Gavaskar says there's a slight grass cover on the pitch and it's going to help the batsmen with their strokeplay. There may even be something for the spinners later on, but not much for the fast bowlers, he says. News even before the toss: Abu Hider and Nazmul Hossain Shanto are making ODI debuts. 2.50pm We saw earlier how both these teams defended totals close to 250. And today, they face off coming on the back of slightly different wins. Bangladesh's top order hardly scored in the tournament opener before Mushfiqur Rahim's century. Afghanistan, on the other hand, exhibited a collective batting display before their bowlers dismantled Sri Lanka. Raqibul: "Hope not only Mushi, but Mash, Fizz and Saqib will also take a break before tomorrows match." Hasib: "Bangladesh should take this match seriously in order to have solid confidence for the super four games." Arshad Ul Mawla: "Strange that they aren't sticking with regular tournament format here. The group topper should be rewarded for their wins by being able to play the runner-ups of the other group. Hope they don't pull this during the WC!" 2.40pm Talking of schedules, we had Pakistan captain Sarfraz Ahmed raise his concerns earlier and this time it's Bangladesh captain Mashrafe Mortaza. His grouses were two-fold and those and all the details are here. Mukhtar Fazly starts things off: "The way India played against HK and Pakistan played against India, chances are that the Winner of Asia Cup 2018 would be Afghanistan or Bangladesh!" 2.30pm It's a tight Asia Cup schedule and we have not just back-to-back games but back-to-back dead rubbers. After a much-anticipated India-Pakistan clash turned out to be a one-sided affair in Dubai, we have Afghanistan against Bangladesh in Abu Dhabi today. For those who don't know, Sri Lanka were knocked out earlier, helping Afghanistan and Bangladesh qualify even before today's match. Does it means both teams will rest key players in the heat of the Middle East and try out new combinations? Mohammad Isam tried some permutations and combinations in the preview. Welcome to our live coverage, I'm Vishal Dikshit, and I'll be joined by Akshay soon enough.

items.preText: AKSHIT KUMAR: "Call me old school but I miss the childhood when the Middle east used to be pacers paradise and not spinner's having the final say. Waqar-Wasim-Imran, where art thou?"
items.text: fullish length ball around the fifth-stump line, punched crisply into the covers
items.shortText: Rubel Hossain to Mohammad Shahzad, no run

items.preText: Vishal tells me that this is the first time Bangladesh are playing an ODI without both Mushfiqur and Tamim since their debuts.
items.text: shuffles across to a length ball and punches to mid-on
items.shortText: Rubel Hossain to Mohammad Shahzad, no run

items.text: gets on top of a shortish one and punches it between mid-on and deep midwicket for a brace
items.shortText: Rubel Hossain to Mohammad Shahzad, 2 runs

items.preText:
Here's the debutant Hider

Manoj: "Rashid has just turned 20 and has already more than 100 ODI wkts. This guy will surely break Murali's 534 wkts tally in ODI's."
items.text: short of a length, slanted across off, punched off the backfoot
items.shortText: Abu Hider to Ihsanullah, no run

items.text: lovely shot. Gets up on the toes to meet the bounce and carves a punch away through the gap at cover
items.shortText: Abu Hider to Ihsanullah, FOUR runs

items.text: nips into the pads from the middle-stump channel, clipped uppishly through the vacant square leg region
items.shortText: Abu Hider to Ihsanullah, FOUR runs

items.text: straight to cover. Wicket in the first over of his debut match for Hider. And it's not a delivery he would've imagined would've fetched him his maiden wicket. Short, ample width, flayed straight and hard into the hands of Mohammad Mithun
items.shortText: Abu Hider to Ihsanullah, OUT

dismissal.text: Ihsanullah c Mohammad Mithun b Abu Hider 8 (4b 2x4 0x6) SR: 200.00

items.preText: Shyam: "@AKSHIT KUMAR it used to be a pacers paradise only because of reverse swing. With 2 new balls now, reverse swing is already in the history books for shorter formats of cricket"
items.text: short of a length, seams into him, Rahmat nudges it out to square leg
items.shortText: Abu Hider to Rahmat Shah, 1 run

items.text: short of a length outside off, punched to point
items.shortText: Abu Hider to Mohammad Shahzad, no run

items.preText: Gamma8: "@Akshay - I was wondering what do you guys do at your break time. I reckon still keep watching match. Here, it Seems Vishal is not having a complete break time, rather supplying stats for you " I do finger push-ups to heal the wear and tear... all while keeping my gaze upwards on the television, of course.

items.preText: Zmn: "There was a time, UAE pitches used to be prepared for Pakistani pacers. But now, these are made for Team India and Indian spinners. What a turn around of World Cricket ! ! !"
